Perhaps the most affecting testimony is that which comes from the few letters
smuggled through the Iron Curtain* One of these sums up the meaning of VOA
broadcasts as follows;
wThose who listen to the Voice of America are risking im¬
prisonment and even death. But this does not frighten us from
listening. On the contrary* it builds up our courage to take
this risk* You will ask me why. Because the Voice is our daily
breads it is the elixir which builds up our strength and rein¬
forces our hope for a better future* free of fear.,.0M
Other informed testimony comes from Dr. Marek Korowicz* member of the
Polish delegation to the UN who defected in New York in September 1953* On
being asked whether the Voice of America was heard in Poland* he replied
that it was, r,by millions and millions of Poles” and continued;
"It is a real sanctuary for the oppressed people and the news
broadcasts from this service go from mouth to mouth* so that even
those people who do not have radio receiving stations /sets7 in a
few hours learn the latest news*,.. I might best /indicate impact
of V0A7 by quoting to you a slogan which is /heard7 throughout my
country; %There are only two moral sanctuaries for the oppressed
people of my country: the Church and the American broadcasts.*"
